body.p: I spent the morning in preparing some notes for an address on "Home Reunion". Then I attended the Memorial Service in Holy Trinity, Sloane Square, for poor Medd. Amery came on afterwards to lunch. Then Kirshbaum and I went to the Collegiate House, hard by S. Thomas's Hospital, where I delivered an address on "Home Reunion" to some 25 parsons. The "discussion" was rather disheartening, but very suggestive in a painful way. I dined with Miss Leslie, who goes to Malta tomorrow.
